poem:
### A Slap in the Desert

Sandstorms whirl  
where shadows conspire,  
a faceless echo  
crashes—across  
lines drawn  
on paper maps.

The earth remembers  
footfalls,  
silent whispers  
gather  
beneath veiled skies.

In waiting winds,  
the air crackles  
with ancient voices—  
unbound.

Power sings  
in tongues  
of dust,  
spinning endless circles  
unseen.
